title: Path Equivalence: Windows 8.3 Filename
overview: On later Windows operating systems, a file can have a long name and a short name that is compatible with older Windows file systems, with up to 8 characters in the filename and 3 characters for the extension. These 8.3 filenames, therefore, act as an alternate name for files with long names, so they are useful pathname equivalence manipulations.
remediation: ::PHASE:System Configuration:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Disable Windows from supporting 8.3 filenames by editing the Windows registry. Preventing 8.3 filenames will not remove previously generated 8.3 filenames.::
